column4: Anyone know how to load an ipod from Ubuntu?  I know you need to change the format of the songs to a .wma file, but when I go to load the song onto it, they never show...any ideas?
the ipod cant play wma, try converting to mp3 first
yes, i believe the ipod supports mp3 and aac
Aeron: When I used the "sound converter", it says that source files cannot be converted--is there another way to switch the files from .ogg to mp3?
are the files currently in .wma? you might need to download a codec before you can convert them
I just downloaded sound converter to try to remedy this
what format is your music in right now?
try running "sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras" without the quotes and try sound converter again
so, what "patch" am I downloading this time [to convert to ogg]
try converting the files to mp3 now. they should play on the ipod now
